name: py-abipy
description: Python package to automate ABINIT calculations and analyze the results.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-six
dependencies.description: Python 2 and 3 compatibility utilities.

dependencies.name: py-prettytable
dependencies.description:
PrettyTable is a simple Python library designed to make it quick and
easy to represent tabular data in visually appealing ASCII tables.

dependencies.name: py-tabulate
dependencies.description: Pretty-print tabular data

dependencies.name: py-apscheduler
dependencies.description: In-process task scheduler with Cron-like capabilities.

dependencies.name: py-pydispatcher
dependencies.description: Multi-producer-multi-consumer signal dispatching mechanism.

dependencies.name: py-tqdm
dependencies.description: A Fast, Extensible Progress Meter

dependencies.name: py-html2text
dependencies.description: Turn HTML into equivalent Markdown-structured text.

dependencies.name: py-pyyaml
dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description:
SciPy (pronounced "Sigh Pie") is a Scientific Library for Python. It
provides many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as
routines for numerical integration and optimization.

dependencies.name: py-spglib
dependencies.description:
Python bindings for C library for finding and handling crystal
symmetries.

dependencies.name: py-pymatgen
dependencies.description:
Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that
defines core object representations for structures and molecules with
support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core
analysis code powering the Materials Project.

dependencies.name: py-netcdf4
dependencies.description: Python interface to the netCDF Library.

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: py-seaborn
dependencies.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.

dependencies.name: py-wxpython
dependencies.description: Cross platform GUI toolkit for Python.

dependencies.name: py-wxmplot
dependencies.description: wxPython plotting widgets using matplotlib.

dependencies.name: py-ipython
dependencies.description:
IPython provides a rich toolkit to help you make the most out of using
Python interactively.

dependencies.name: py-jupyter
dependencies.description: Jupyter metapackage. Install all the Jupyter components in one go.

dependencies.name: py-nbformat
dependencies.description: The Jupyter Notebook format
